abstracts.cdata!:
This agricultural rehabilitation project
            for Chad has two distinct objectives for rehabilitating the
            agricultural sector and accelerating development in the wake
            of a devastating civil war (1979-82) and a debilitating
            drought (1984). First, it would improve coordination through
            the development of key rural institutions and the emergency
            rehabilitation of productive facilities in the rural sector.
            Improved coordination would be achieved through
            institutional development of such key services as the
            Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development. This would be
            accomplished by providing resident experts, consulting
            services, vehicles and equipment. The emergency
            rehabilitation of productive facilities would involve
            re-establishing and developing immediately productive
            facilities in the rural sector, both for public sector
            enterprises and for key rural development services. Second,
            for the long term, this project would enhance the
            Government's ability to guide agricultural planning and
            development by implementing pilot actions to establish
            optimum approaches in rural development and by carrying out
            key sub-sector studies. Pilot actions to be initiated, for
            example, would include testing new technologies for
            expanding food crop production and water resource maintenance.
